channel.title: Bloomberg Markets
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Euronext Says It’s in Talks to Buy Athens Stock Exchange
item.description: Euronext NV said it is in talks to buy the Athens stock markets operator, a move it says would help integrate Greek capital markets into the Eurozone and increase their international development.
item.dc:creator: Samy Adghirni

media:content.media:description: Hellenic Exchanges - Athens Stock Exchange in Athens. Photographer: Nick Paleologos/Bloomberg

item.title: Gold Rises With Trump’s Tax Bill Seen Widening US Deficits
item.description: Gold rose for a second day as investors weigh President Donald Trump’s tax bill, which is expected to further expand US deficits.
item.dc:creator: Jack Ryan

media:content.media:description: One kilogram gold bars. Photographer: Brendon Thorne/Bloomberg

item.title: Powell on Fed Policy: ‘For Now, We’re Waiting’
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell says the US economy is in a “pretty good position” and inflation has come down to close to 2% during a policy panel moderated by Bloomberg Television’s Francine Lacqua at the ECB Forum on Central Banking 2025 in Sintra, Portugal. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: UK Budget Watchdog Admits Optimism Bias in Blow to Reeves
item.description: Britain’s fiscal watchdog said it has been too optimistic about the country’s medium-term growth prospects and promised a full evaluation of the economy’s speed limit over the summer in what will be a crucial moment for Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves.
item.dc:creator: Philip Aldrick

item.title: Trump on Fed Chair: Anybody Would Be Better Than Powell
item.description: President Donald Trump reiterates his criticism of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell while touring the so-called “Alligator Alcatraz” immigrant detention center.

item.title: Saudis Led Surge in OPEC Stalwarts Oil Exports Last Month
item.description: Saudi Arabia led a surge in crude exports from stalwart oil-producing giants in the Middle East in June.
item.dc:creator: Julian Lee, Prejula Prem, Erik Olsson

item.title: Feud Between Tesla's Elon Musk and Trump Escalates
item.description: The feud between Elon Musk and President Donald Trump keeps on escalating. Trump threatened to withdraw government subsidies from Musk's companies. Musk has been stepping up his criticism of Trump's tax and spending bill. Ed Ludlow reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Treasury Yields Drop to Lowest Level in Two Months Before Powell Speaks
item.description: Treasury yields rose after the first of this week’s three reports on US labor-market conditions failed to provide justification for a Federal Reserve interest-rate cut as soon as next month.
item.dc:creator: Michael Mackenzie

item.title: Morgan Stanley's Zavolock on Investing In Europe
item.description: Morgan Stanley Chief European Equity Strategist Marina Zavolock discusses markets in Europe compared to the US. She speaks with Kriti Gupta and Guy Johnson on "The Opening Trade." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Bank of Singapore's Ayub on US Stocks, Fed
item.description: Mehvish Ayub, Bank of Singapore, Head of Managed Solutions Advisory, discusses Fed moves and US stocks with Bloomberg's Lizzy Burden in Dubai. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: M&A Deal Rise | Nina Trentmann, CFO Briefing
item.description: CFOs are actually saying, yes, of course. Nina Trentmann talks on Bloomberg "The Close". (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US Stocks Decline as Traders Eye Economic Data, Tax Bill Talks
item.description: US stocks took a breather on the first day of July after the S&P 500 posted two consecutive records and notched the best quarter since 2023.
item.dc:creator: Natalia Kniazhevich

media:content.media:description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune returns to his office from the Senate Chamber during a vote-a-rama at the US Capitol in Washington, DC, on June 30.

item.title: Do You Know What’s in the GOP’s Tax Bill?
item.description: Only 48% of Americans have heard anything about the so-called "Big Beautiful Bill." Bloomberg Opinion columnist Sarah Green Carmichael wonders if you'll it. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Bloomberg Surveillance 7/1/2025
item.description: Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Annmarie Hordern speak daily with leaders and decision makers from Wall Street to Washington and beyond. No other program better positions investors and executives for the trading day. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Citi Sees Zambian Kwacha Rally Extending If Copper-Price Link Restored
item.description: Zambia’s currency appears set for sustained gains if its correlation with the copper price is restored, Citigroup Inc said.
item.dc:creator: Ray Ndlovu, Taonga Mitimingi

media:content.media:description: A worker marks stacks of copper plates ready for shipping at the Mufulira refinery, operated by Mopani Copper Mines Plc, in Mufulira, Zambia, on Friday, May 6, 2022. A recent 1,900-mile journey from mines in Congo and Zambia shows how, a century after commercial mining began here, the world’s hunger for copper is again reshaping the region. Photographer: Zinyange Auntony/Bloomberg

item.title: Thune Believes Senate Has Votes to Pass Trump Tax Bill
item.description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune believes there is enough Republican support of President Donald Trump’s tax and spending bill and said his chamber will soon vote on passage of the legislation. Kailey Leinz reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Credit Demand Remains Robust: JPMorgan's Berro
item.description: JPMorgan Asset Management Fixed Income Portfolio Manager Kelsey Berro Kelsey Berro, Fixed Income Portfolio Manager at JPMorgan Asset Management, discusses continuing dollar weakness and demand for Treasuries. She speaks with Dani Burger on "Bloomberg Brief." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Airbus Said to Deliver About 60 Planes in June, Short of Target
item.description: Airbus SE delivered about 60 aircraft in June, people familiar with the matter said, requiring the European planemaker to step up output in the second half of the year to achieve its full-year target.
item.dc:creator: Siddharth Philip

media:content.media:description: A CFM International SA LEAP engine for an Airbus SE A320neo aircraft at the Safran SA plant in Colomiers, France, on Tuesday, March 25, 2025. Safran Nacelles manufactures nacelles for short, medium and long-range commercial aircraft.

item.title: Washington Needs Fiscal Hawks, Says Guggenheim's Walsh
item.description: Guggenheim Partners Investment Management CIO Anne Walsh says the growing national debt and deficit spending are a concern, and there is a need for fiscal discipline in Washington. Walsh appears on this week's episode of Bloomberg Wealth with David Rubenstein. This interview was recorded June 9 in New York. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Guggenheim's Walsh Says Fed Has Room to Lower Rates Now
item.description: Guggenheim Partners Investment Management CIO Anne Walsh says the Federal Reserve may have room to lower interest rates but must be cautious not to appear as though it is "kowtowing" to political pressure from President Donald Trump. Walsh speaks with Carlyle Co-Founder & Co-Chairman David Rubenstein on this week's episode of Bloomberg Wealth. This interview was recorded June 9 in New York. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: AMC Inks Deal With Creditors to End Litigation, Raise Money
item.description: AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc. said it reached an agreement with a majority of bondholders to end litigation that resulted from the movie theater chain’s debt restructuring last year, according to a statement on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Reshmi Basu, Irene Garcia Perez

media:content.media:description: An AMC movie theater in New York, US, on Monday, Feb. 5, 2024. AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on February 28.

item.title: US Manufacturing Activity Contracted in June for a Fourth Month
item.description: US factory activity contracted in June for a fourth consecutive month as orders and employment shrank at a faster pace, extending the malaise in manufacturing.
item.dc:creator: Nazmul Ahasan

media:content.media:description: A worker arc welds a metal door during production at the Metal Manufacturing Co. facility in Sacramento, California, US, on Tuesday, May 27, 2025. The US Census Bureau is scheduled to release factory orders figures on June 3.

item.title: FTSE 100 Live: Gilt Yields Fall Ahead of Welfare Vote
Stocks Halt Rally as Job Openings Lift Bond Yields: Markets Wrap
item.description: A rally that drove stocks to all-time highs lost steam and bond yields rose as an unexpected increase in job openings dimmed the outlook for Federal Reserve rate cuts, with Chair Jerome Powell reiterating his wait-and-see stance amid the threat of tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

item.title: ECB Wonders Whether Euro Rally Will Turn From Blessing to Curse
item.description: European Central Bank officials are starting to fret that a rapid appreciation of the euro could derail efforts to anchor inflation at 2%.
item.dc:creator: Jana Randow, Alexander Weber, Mark Schroers

media:content.media:description: ECB President Christine Lagarde speaks at the ECB Forum in Sintra, Portugal, on June 30.

item.title: Oil Steadies as Dollar Eases and Middle East Tensions Simmer
item.description: Oil steadied near the lowest levels in a month as tensions flare up in the energy-rich Middle East, returning the spotlight to the fragility of a truce between Israel and Iran.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis, Catherine Cartier

media:content.media:description: Crude oil storage tanks at the Juaymah Tank Farm in Saudi Aramco's Ras Tanura oil refinery and oil terminal in Ras Tanura, Saudi Arabia, on Monday, Oct. 1, 2018. Saudi Arabia is seeking to transform its crude-dependent economy by developing new industries, and is pushing into petrochemicals as a way to earn more from its energy deposits.

item.title: Copper Rises to Three-Month High on China Manufacturing Rebound
item.description: Copper rose to a three-month high, boosted by buying towards the close of trading in China, on signs factory activity is recovering in the world’s second-largest economy.
item.dc:creator: Julian Luk

item.title: One Square Partner Is Tried in Germany Over Sympatex Debt Deal
item.description: A partner of financial advisory firm One Square Advisors is among a group of people standing trial in Munich accused of defrauding bondholders of a German textile company out of €1 million ($1.2 million).
item.dc:creator: Libby Cherry

item.title: Ex-Mizuho Bond Traders Lose Bid to Lift UK Bans Over Spoofing
item.description: A trio of ex-Mizuho International Plc government bond traders accused by the UK’s City watchdog of market abuse lost their bid to challenge their ban from financial services.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Browning

media:content.media:description: Illuminated signage for Mizuho Bank Ltd., a unit of Mizuho Financial Group Inc. (MHFG), displayed outside a branch at night in Tokyo, Japan, on Wednesday, Jan. 25, 2023. Japan's mega banks are scheduled to release its third-quarter earnings figures next week. Photographer: Kiyoshi Ota/Bloomberg

item.title: Russia's Crude Oil Shipments Stick Close to a Two-Month Low
item.description: Lower exports from smaller ports offset increased flows from two key terminals
item.dc:creator: Julian Lee

media:content.media:description: Oil and LNG tanker vessels offshore from the Fort de Bouc in the industrial and port area of Martigues, France, on Monday, Jan. 6, 2023. The European Union on Sunday ratcheted up its sanctions against President Vladimir Putin's regime, putting in place a long-planned ban on seaborne imports of Russian fuels.
